title: Leroy Sane lifts lid on best thing about playing for Man City - and names the teammate he loves to wind up
text:
Get football   Thank you for subscribing!   
Pep Guardiola named Leroy Sane the future of Manchester City, alongside Raheem Sterling and Gabriel Jesus - and it's easy to see why. 
The German youngster, who signed from Schalke for an initial Â£37million in the summer, has become a crucial part of the Spaniard's side. 
The 21-year-old's pace has been a welcome addition to the first XI, and Sane has netted six times in his last 12 games, becoming a fans' favourite in the process. 
And it seems the feeling is mutual at the Etihad, with the talented youngster admitting he is very happy at the club. Leroy Sane is enjoying life at Manchester City (Photo: PA) Sane praised the influence of Pep Guardiola (Photo: REUTERS) 
Speaking on BBC's Football Focus, the German spoke about what makes playing for City so enjoyable. 
"I am happy to have made the move to Manchester City," said Sane. 
"It's been great fun working with him [Guardiola] because you can learn a huge amount from him, and I have already learnt a lot. The German admitted to teasing Yaya Toure in training (Photo: Getty) Sane insisted Raheem Sterling is the man behind the Yaya jokes (Photo: Laurence Griffiths) 
"Also he is very ambitious and wants to win all the time and wants to improve every player." 
In the same interview, the forward also revealed he loves to poke fun at Yaya Toure, who he calls "Uncle" on the training ground.
